text: 1.0.1 This Acceptable Solution is limited to buildings and sitework having a catchment area of no more than 0.25 hectares and which are: a) Free from a history of flooding, b) Not adjacent to a watercourse, c) Not located in low lying area, and d) Not located in a secondary flow path.
lrml: if( and( expression( function( less than equal), atom( variable( catchment area)), data( 0.25ha)), not( not( function( equal), atom( variable( catchment area)), data( floodprone))), not( not( function( adjacent), atom( relation( location), variable( catchment area)), data( watercourse))), not( not( function( equal), atom( variable( catchment area)), data( low lying))), not( not( function( within), atom( relation( location), variable( catchment area)), data( secondary flow path))))), then( and( obligation( expression( function( comply with), atom( variable( building)), data( nzbc e1))), expression( function( comply with), atom( variable( sitework)), data( nzbc e1))))

text: 2.0.1 Suspended floors and slabs on ground shall be at least 150 mm above the finished level of the surrounding ground immediately adjacent to the building
lrml: if( and( expression( function( equal), atom( relation( elevation), variable( suspended floor)), data( z1)), expression( function( equal), atom( relation( elevation), variable( slab on ground)), data( z2)), expression( function( equal), atom( relation( elevation), variable( ground)), data( z3)))), then( and( obligation( expression( function( greater than equal), atom( variable( z1)), data( z3+150mm))), expression( function( greater than equal), atom( variable( z2)), data( z3+150mm))))

text: 2.0.1 Suspended floors and slabs on ground shall be at least 150 mm above the finished level of the surrounding ground immediately adjacent to the building, and: a) For sites level with or above the road, no less than 150 mm above the road crown on at least one cross-section through the building and roadway (see Figure 1).
lrml: if( and( expression( function( equal), atom( relation( elevation), variable( suspended floor)), data( z1)), expression( function( equal), atom( relation( elevation), variable( slab on ground)), data( z2)), expression( function( equal), atom( relation( elevation), variable( site)), data( z3)), expression( function( equal), atom( relation( elevation), variable( road)), data( z4)), expression( function( greater than equal), atom( variable( z3)), data( z4)), expression( function( equal), atom( relation( elevation), variable( road crown)), data( z5)))), then( and( obligation( expression( function( greater than equal), atom( variable( z1)), data( z5+150mm))), expression( function( greater than equal), atom( variable( z2)), data( z5+150mm))))

text: 2.0.1 Suspended floors and slabs on ground shall be, for sites below the road, no less than 150 mm above the lowest point on the site boundary (see Figure 2).
lrml: if( and( expression( function( equal), atom( relation( elevation), variable( suspended floor)), data( z1)), expression( function( equal), atom( relation( elevation), variable( slab on ground)), data( z2)), expression( function( equal), atom( relation( elevation), variable( site)), data( z3)), expression( function( equal), atom( relation( elevation), variable( road)), data( z4)), expression( function( less than), atom( variable( z3)), data( z4)), expression( function( equal), atom( relation( elevation), variable( lowest point on site boundary)), data( z5)))), then( and( obligation( expression( function( greater than equal), atom( variable( z1)), data( z5+150mm))), expression( function( greater than equal), atom( variable( z2)), data( z5+150mm))))

text: 3.1.1 Pipe materials shall comply with the standards given in Table 1.
lrml: if( expression( function( equal), atom( relation( material), variable( pipe)), data( true))), then( obligation( expression( function( comply with), atom( relation( material), variable( pipe)), data( t 1))))

text: Drains shall be capable of handling the rainfall during a storm. No drain shall have an internal diameter of less than 85 mm
lrml: if( expression( function( equal), atom( relation( type), variable( drain)), data( stormwater))), then( obligation( expression( function( greater than equal), atom( relation( internal diameter), variable( drain)), data( 85mm))))

text: 3.2.2 Figure 3 provides a method for selecting the correct pipe size for a calculated modified catchment area, given as: Modified catchment area = 0.01 Al, where A = area being drained comprising plan roof area (m2) plus paved area (m2).
lrml: if( and( expression( function( equal), atom( relation( area), variable( plan roof)), data( a1)), expression( function( equal), atom( relation( area), variable( paved area)), data( a2)), expression( function( equal), atom( variable( rainfall intensity)), data( i1)))), then( and( obligation( expression( function( equal), atom( variable( modified catchment area)), data( 0.01*( ( a1+a2)*i1)))), permission( expression( function( equal), atom( relation( gradient), variable( drain)), data( eval( figure 3))))))

text: 3.3.1 Drains shall be laid on a uniform line and gradient between points of access (see Paragraph 3.7).
lrml: if( and( expression( function( in between), atom( relation( section), variable( drain)), and( data( access point 1), data( access point 2))), expression( function( adjacent), atom( variable( access point 1)), data( access point 2)))), then( expression( function( of), expression( function( for each), atom( variable( section))), data( drain)))

text: The change in direction of a drain shall not exceed 90° at any point
lrml: if( expression( function( include), atom( variable( drain)), data( change in direction))), then( obligation( expression( function( less than), atom( variable( change in direction)), data( 90°))))

text: The change in direction of a drain where practical should be kept to less than 45° as illustrated in Figure 4.
lrml: if( expression( function( is), atom( variable( change in direction)), data( practical))), then( obligation( expression( function( less than), atom( relation( change in direction), variable( drain)), data( 45°))))

text: 3.3.2 Where two drains intersect, the directions of flow as shown in Figure 5 shall be at an angle of 60° or less.
lrml: if( expression( function( include), atom( variable( drain)), data( drain intersection))), then( obligation( expression( function( less than equal), atom( relation( angle), variable( direction of flow)), data( 60°))))

text: 3.4.1 Minimum acceptable gradients for surface water drains are given in Table 2.
lrml: if( expression( function( equal), atom( variable( surface water drain)), data( true))), then( expression( function( comply with), expression( function( min), atom( relation( gradient), variable( surface water drain))), data( t 2)))

text: 3.4.2 Restricted fall to outlet; Where the surface water sewer, road channel or other outfall is at too high a level to allow the gradient required by Table 2, the bubble-up chamber system shown in Figures 6 and 7 may be used.
lrml: if( expression( function( greater than), atom( relation( elevation), variable( outfall)), data( eval( t 2)))), then( permission( expression( function( has), atom( variable( drain)), data( bubbleup chamber))))

text: The ground level adjacent to any downpipe discharging to the bubble-up chamber is at least 150 mm higher than the level of the top of the chamber outlet.
lrml: if( and( expression( function( has), atom( variable( drain)), data( bubbleup chamber)), expression( function( discharge into), atom( variable( downpipe)), data( bubbleup chamber)), expression( function( adjacent), atom( variable( ground)), data( downpipe)), expression( function( equal), atom( relation( elevation), variable( ground)), data( h1)), expression( function( equal), atom( relation( top of outlet), variable( bubbleup chamber)), data( x)), expression( function( equal), atom( relation( elevation), variable( x)), data( h2)), expression( function( greater than equal), atom( variable( h1)), data( h2+150)))), then( permission( expression( function( has), atom( variable( drain)), data( bubbleup chamber))))

text: 3.0 Drainage System Materials and Construction; The bubble-up chamber system shown in Figures 6 and 7 may be used provided that: The connections between the drain and downpipes are sealed.
lrml: if( permission( expression( function( has), atom( variable( drain)), data( bubbleup chamber)))), then( and( obligation( expression( function( in between), atom( variable( connection)), and( data( drain), data( downpipe)))), expression( function( is), atom( variable( connection)), data( sealed))))

lrml: if( permission( expression( function( has), atom( variable( drain)), data( bubbleup chamber)))), then( obligation( expression( function( less than equal), atom( relation( depth), variable( bubbleup chamber)), data( 1m))))

text: 3.5.1 All joints in drains shall be watertight and prevent the infiltration of groundwater and the intrusion of tree roots.
lrml: if( expression( function( include), atom( variable( drain)), data( joint))), then( and( obligation( expression( function( equal), atom( relation( joint), variable( drain)), data( watertight))), expression( function( prevent), atom( relation( joint), variable( drain)), data( groundwater infiltration)), expression( function( prevent), atom( relation( joint), variable( drain)), data( tree root intrusion))))

text: 3.5.2 Acceptable jointing methods and the relevant standards are given in Table 3. Jointing of drains shall be subject to the tests called for in Paragraph 3.8.
lrml: if( expression( function( include), atom( variable( drain)), data( joint))), then( and( obligation( expression( function( comply with), atom( variable( drain)), data( t 3))), expression( function( comply with), atom( variable( drain)), data( 3.8.0.1))))

text: 3.6.1 All surface water, except that collected directly from a roof, shall enter the drain via a sump
lrml: if( expression( function( collected from), atom( variable( surface water)), data( roof))), then( obligation( expression( function( equal), atom( variable( drain inlet)), data( sump))))

text: 3.6 Surface water inlets to drains; Via a sump which has: a) A grating, hinged or removable for maintenance access. The grating shall comprise at least 35% openings. The smaller dimension of any individual opening shall not exceed 35 mm
lrml: if( expression( function( equal), atom( variable( drain inlet)), data( sump))), then( and( obligation( expression( function( include), atom( variable( sump)), data( sump grating))), expression( function( equal), atom( variable( sump grating)), or( data( hinged), data( removable))), expression( function( equal), atom( relation( opening), variable( sump grating)), data( 35 %)), expression( function( less than equal), expression( function( min), atom( relation( opening), variable( sump grating))), data( 35mm))))

text: 3.6 Surface water inlets to drains; Via a sump which has: Capacity at the bottom for settlement of silt and debris
lrml: if( expression( function( equal), atom( variable( drain inlet)), data( sump))), then( obligation( expression( function( include), atom( variable( sump)), data( settlement capacity))))

text: 3.6 Surface water inlets to drains; Via a sump which has: A submerged (or trapped) outlet which prevents floatable solids entering the drain.
lrml: if( expression( function( equal), atom( variable( drain inlet)), data( sump))), then( or( obligation( expression( function( include), atom( variable( sump)), data( submerged outlet))), expression( function( include), atom( variable( sump)), data( trapped outlet))))

text: 3.7.1 Access for maintenance shall be provided on all drains
lrml: if( expression( function( equal), atom( variable( drain)), data( true))), then( obligation( expression( function( include), atom( variable( drain)), data( access point))))

text: 3.7.2 Points of access shall be spaced at no further than: a) 50 m where rodding points are used.
lrml: if( expression( function( equal), atom( variable( access point)), data( rodding point))), then( obligation( expression( function( less than equal), atom( relation( spacing), variable( access point)), data( 50m))))

text: 3.7.2 Points of access shall be spaced at no further than: 100 m where inspection points, inspection chambers or access chambers are used.
lrml: if( or( expression( function( equal), atom( variable( access point)), data( inspection point)), expression( function( equal), atom( variable( access point)), data( inspection chamber)), expression( function( equal), atom( variable( access point)), data( access chamber)))), then( obligation( expression( function( less than equal), atom( relation( spacing), variable( access point)), data( 100m))))

text: 3.7.3 Points of access are required at: Changes in direction of greater than 45°,
lrml: if( and( expression( function( include), atom( variable( drain direction)), data( change in drain direction)), expression( function( greater than), atom( variable( change in drain direction)), data( 45°)))), then( obligation( expression( function( located at), atom( variable( access point)), data( change in drain direction))))

text: 3.7.3 Points of access are required at: Changes in gradient of greater than 45°
lrml: if( and( expression( function( include), atom( variable( drain)), data( change in drain gradient)), expression( function( greater than), atom( variable( change in drain gradient)), data( 45°)))), then( obligation( expression( function( located at), atom( variable( access point)), data( change in drain gradient))))

text: 3.7.3 Points of access are required at: Junctions of drains other than a drain, serving a single downpipe, that is less than 2.0 m long.
lrml: if( and( expression( function( include), atom( variable( drain)), data( drain junction)), not( not( function( less than), atom( variable( drain length)), data( 2m))), not( not( function( equal), expression( function( count), atom( variable( downpipe))), data( 1))))), then( obligation( expression( function( located at), atom( variable( access point)), data( drain junction))))

text: 3.7.4 Inspection chambers or access chambers (see Figures 11 and 12) shall be provided where changes in both gradient and direction occur and where either is greater than 22.5°.
lrml: if( or( expression( function( include), atom( variable( drain)), data( change in drain gradient)), expression( function( located at), atom( variable( change in drain gradient)), data( change in drain direction)), expression( function( greater than), atom( variable( change in drain gradient)), data( 22.5°)), expression( function( greater than), atom( variable( change in drain direction)), data( 22.5°)))), then( obligation( expression( function( located at), atom( variable( access point)), data( change in drain gradient))))

text: 3.7.5 Where the depth to the invert of the drain exceeds 1.0 m, an inspection chamber is not acceptable and an access chamber shall be used.
lrml: if( expression( function( greater than), atom( relation( depth), variable( drain invert)), data( 1m))), then( obligation( expression( function( equal), atom( variable( access point)), data( access chamber))))

text: 3.7.6 Drain under buildings; Any drain laid under a building shall be run in a straight line from one side to the other.
lrml: if( expression( function( beneath), atom( relation( section), variable( drain)), data( building))), then( obligation( not( expression( function( include), atom( variable( section)), data( change in drain direction)))))

text: 3.7.7 Access to a drain laid under a building shall be provided immediately outside the building. These points of access shall be located within 2.0 m of an exterior wall.
lrml: if( expression( function( beneath), atom( variable( drain)), data( building))), then( and( obligation( expression( function( immediately outside), atom( variable( access point)), data( building))), expression( function( less than), atom( variable( access point)), data( 2m))))

text: 3.7.8 Under a building the only acceptable inlets to a drain are from sealed roof-water downpipes.
lrml: if( expression( function( beneath), atom( variable( drain inlet)), data( building))), then( and( obligation( expression( function( equal), atom( variable( drain inlet)), data( downpipe))), expression( function( equal), atom( variable( drain inlet)), data( sealed))))

text: Access shall be provided to the drain via a sealed access point in the downpipe immediately above ground floor level.
lrml: if( expression( function( beneath), atom( variable( drain inlet)), data( building))), then( and( obligation( expression( function( equal), atom( variable( access point)), data( sealed))), expression( function( immediately above), atom( variable( access point)), data( ground floor level)), expression( function( within), atom( variable( access point)), data( downpipe))))

text: 3.8.1 Surface water drains shall be capable of passing one of the tests described in E1/VM1 Paragraph 8.0.
lrml: if( expression( function( equal), atom( relation( type), variable( drain)), data( surface water))), then( obligation( expression( function( comply with), atom( variable( drain)), data( e1/vm1 paragraph 8.0))))

text: 3.9.2 Bedding and backfilling; Figure 13 gives acceptable solutions for the bedding and backfilling of the drainage pipes listed in Table 1 except where: a) The trench is located within or above peat, or b) Scouring of the trench is likely due to unstable soils, or d) The cover H to the pipe is more than 2.5 m.
lrml: if( and( expression( function( equal), atom( variable( pipe)), data( true)), not( not( function( within), atom( relation( located), variable( trench)), data( peat))), not( not( function( above), atom( relation( located), variable( trench)), data( peat))), not( not( function( equal), atom( variable( soil)), data( unstable))), not( not( function( greater than), atom( relation( cover), variable( pipe)), data( 2.5m))))), then( permission( expression( function( comply with), atom( variable( fill)), data( figure 13))))

text: 3.9.3 Trench slope; Where the slope of the trench is 1 in 8 or greater, anti-scour blocks shall be provided.
lrml: if( expression( function( greater than equal), atom( variable( trench slope)), data( 1 in 8))), then( obligation( expression( function( include), atom( variable( trench)), data( anti scour blocks))))

text: These anti-scour blocks shall be: Constructed from 150 mm thick concrete (17 MPa)
lrml: if( expression( function( include), atom( variable( trench)), data( anti scour blocks))), then( and( obligation( expression( function( equal), atom( relation( material), variable( anti scour blocks)), data( concrete))), obligation( expression( function( equal), atom( relation( thickness), variable( anti scour blocks)), data( 150mm))), obligation( expression( function( equal), atom( relation( strength), variable( anti scour blocks)), data( 17mpa)))))

text: These anti-scour blocks shall be: Extended to ground level where the drain cover is less than 300 mm
lrml: if( and( expression( function( include), atom( variable( trench)), data( anti scour blocks)), expression( function( less than), atom( relation( depth), variable( drain cover)), data( 300mm)))), then( expression( function( equal), atom( relation( height), variable( anti scour blocks)), data( ground level)))

text: These anti-scour blocks shall be: Spaced at: 7.5 m centres for trench slopes between 1 in 8 and 1 in 5
lrml: if( and( expression( function( include), atom( variable( trench)), data( anti scour blocks)), expression( function( less than), atom( variable( trench slope)), data( 1 in 5)), expression( function( greater than equal), atom( variable( trench slope)), data( 1 in 8)))), then( obligation( expression( function( equal), atom( relation( spacing), variable( anti scour blocks)), data( 7.5m centres))))

text: These anti-scour blocks shall be: Spaced at: 5.0 m centres for trench slopes greater than 1 in 5.
lrml: if( and( expression( function( include), atom( variable( trench)), data( anti scour blocks)), expression( function( greater than), atom( variable( trench slope)), data( 1 in 5)))), then( obligation( expression( function( equal), atom( relation( spacing), variable( anti scour blocks)), data( 5.0m centres))))

text: 3.9.4 Trench width; The width B of the trench shall be no less than the pipe diameter D plus 200 mm. Trench width at the top of the pipe shall be no more than 600 mm unless the pipe(s) in the trench are covered with concrete, as shown in Figure 13 (c).
lrml: if( and( expression( function( equal), atom( relation( service), variable( trench)), data( true)), expression( function( is), atom( relation( width), variable( trench)), data( b)), expression( function( is), atom( relation( diameter), variable( pipe)), data( d)), expression( function( is), expression( function( top of), atom( variable( pipe))), data( t)))), then( and( obligation( expression( function( greater than equal), atom( relation( width), variable( b)), data( ( d+200)mm))), or( obligation( expression( function( less than equal), atom( relation( width), variable( t)), data( 600mm))), and( obligation( expression( function( has), atom( variable( trench)), data( cover))), obligation( expression( function( is), atom( relation( material), variable( cover)), data( concrete)))))))

text: Acceptable fill materials shown in Figure 13 are: Bedding material of clean granular non-cohesive material with a maximum particle size of 20 mm
lrml: if( expression( function( include), atom( variable( trench)), data( bedding))), then( and( obligation( expression( function( equal), atom( relation( material), variable( bedding)), data( clean))), expression( function( equal), atom( relation( material), variable( bedding)), data( granular)), expression( function( equal), atom( relation( material), variable( bedding)), data( non-cohesive)), expression( function( less than equal), atom( relation( size), variable( bedding particle)), data( 20mm))))

text: Acceptable fill materials shown in Figure 13 are: Selected compacted fill of any fine-grained soil or granular material which is free from topsoil and rubbish and has a maximum particle size of 20 mm
lrml: if( expression( function( include), atom( variable( trench)), data( compacted fill))), then( and( obligation( expression( function( equal), atom( relation( material), variable( compacted fill)))), not( not( function( include), atom( relation( material), variable( compacted fill)), data( topsoil))), not( not( function( include), atom( relation( material), variable( compacted fill)), data( rubbish))), expression( function( less than equal), atom( relation( size), variable( compacted fill particle)), data( 20mm))))

text: Acceptable fill materials shown in Figure 13 are: Ordinary fill which may comprise any fill or excavated material.
lrml: if( expression( function( include), atom( variable( trench)), data( ordinary fill))), then( or( permission( expression( function( include), atom( variable( ordinary fill)), data( excavated material))), expression( function( include), atom( variable( ordinary fill)), data( any fill))))

text: 3.9.6 Placing and compacting a) Granular bedding and selected fill shall be placed in layers of no greater than 100 mm loose thickness and compacted.
lrml: if( expression( function( include), atom( variable( trench)), or( data( bedding), data( compacted fill)))), then( and( obligation( expression( function( in), atom( variable( granular bedding)), data( layer))), obligation( expression( function( in), atom( variable( granular fill)), data( layer))), obligation( expression( function( less than equal), atom( relation( thickness), variable( layer)), data( 100mm))), obligation( expression( function( is), atom( variable( layer)), data( compacted)))))

text: 4.1.1 Materials for downpipes shall comply with Table 4.
lrml: if( expression( function( equal), atom( variable( downpipe)), data( true))), then( obligation( expression( function( comply with), atom( relation( material), variable( downpipe)), data( t 4))))

text: 4.1.2 Downpipes, gutters, roofing, fastenings and all adjoining components shall be of the same or a compatible material to eliminate the risk of galvanic corrosion.
lrml: if( and( expression( function( include), atom( relation( component pair), variable( roof system)), and( data( component 1), data( component 2))), expression( function( adjacent), atom( variable( component 1)), data( component 1)))), then( expression( function( of), expression( function( for each), atom( variable( component pair))), data( roof system), obligation( expression( function( is), atom( relation( material), variable( component pair)), data( galvanically compatible)))))

text: 4.2.1 Downpipes sized using Table 5 are acceptable. Other downpipes are acceptable provided their cross-sectional area is no less than that required by Table 5, and they permit passage of a 50 mm diameter sphere.
lrml: if( expression( function( equal), atom( variable( downpipe)), data( true))), then( or( permission( expression( function( comply with), atom( relation( size), variable( downpipe)), data( t 5))), and( expression( function( greater than equal), atom( relation( cross-section), variable( downpipe)), data( eval( t 5))), expression( function( permit passage), atom( variable( downpipe)), data( 50mm diameter sphere)))))

text: 4.3.1 Where thermal movement of downpipes cannot be accommodated by movement of the guttering, expansion joints shall be incorporated.
lrml: if( and( expression( function( has), atom( variable( downpipe)), data( thermal expansion)), not( not( function( allow), atom( variable( guttering)), data( movement))))), then( or( obligation( expression( function( include), atom( variable( downpipe)), data( expansion joint))), expression( function( include), atom( variable( guttering)), data( expansion joint))))

text: 4.3.2 All internal downpipes shall withstand without leakage, a water test with an applied head of 1.5 m of water, or a high pressure air test as described in E1/VM1 Paragraph 8.3.
lrml: if( expression( function( equal), atom( relation( location), variable( downpipe)), data( internal))), then( or( and( obligation( expression( function( comply with), atom( variable( downpipe)), data( water test))), expression( function( equal), atom( relation( applied head), variable( water test)), data( 1.5m))), and( obligation( expression( function( comply with), atom( variable( downpipe)), data( air test))), expression( function( comply with), atom( variable( air test)), data( e1/vm1 paragraph 8.3)))))

text: 5.1.1 Roof gutters shall discharge to downpipes that are sized as given in Paragraph 4.2.
lrml: if( expression( function( equal), atom( relation( location), variable( gutter)), data( roof))), then( and( obligation( expression( function( into), atom( variable( gutter discharge)), data( downpipe))), expression( function( comply with), atom( relation( size), variable( downpipe)), data( 4.2.1.0.1))))

text: 5.1.4 In no case shall the cross-sectional area of any gutter be less than 4000 mm2.
lrml: if( expression( function( equal), atom( relation( location), variable( gutter)), data( roof))), then( prohibition( not( expression( function( less than), atom( relation( cross sectional area), variable( gutter)), data( 4000mm^2)))))

text: 5.2.1 Roof gutter materials shall comply with the standards stated in Table 6.
lrml: if( expression( function( equal), atom( relation( location), variable( gutter)), data( roof))), then( obligation( expression( function( comply with), atom( relation( material), variable( gutter)), data( t 6))))

text: 5.3.1 Roof gutters shall fall to an outlet.
lrml: if( expression( function( equal), atom( relation( location), variable( gutter)), data( roof))), then( obligation( expression( function( towards), atom( relation( direction), variable( gutter fall)), data( outlet))))

text: 5.5.1 All internal gutters shall be fitted with overflow outlets which drain to the exterior of the building. The top of the outlet shall be set at least 50 mm below the top of the gutter.
lrml: if( and( expression( function( equal), atom( variable( roof gutter type)), data( internal)), expression( function( equal), atom( relation( elevation), variable( roof gutter top)), data( g1)))), then( and( obligation( expression( function( include), atom( variable( roof gutter)), data( overflow outlet))), expression( function( equal), atom( relation( drain to), variable( overflow outlet)), data( building exterior)), expression( function( less than equal), atom( variable( overflow outlet top)), data( g1-50mm))))

text: 5.5.2 External gutters do not require overflow outlets but shall be installed to ensure any overflow from the gutter spills to the outside of the building.
lrml: if( expression( function( equal), atom( variable( roof gutter type)), data( external))), then( and( permission( expression( function( equal), atom( variable( overflow outlet)), data( not required))), obligation( expression( function( equal), atom( relation( drain to), variable( roof gutter overflow)), data( building exterior)))))

text: 1.1.1 Building elements, including materials, components and systems, complying with a publication referenced in the Acceptable Solutions and Verification Methods, satisfy B2 requirements only when the conditions of use stated in the publication and Acceptable Solutions and Verification Methods prevail.
lrml: if( and( expression( function( comply with), atom( relation( element), variable( building)), data( publication)), expression( function( comply with), atom( relation( material), variable( building)), data( publication)), expression( function( comply with), atom( relation( component), variable( building)), data( publication)), expression( function( comply with), atom( relation( system), variable( building)), data( publication)), expression( function( referenced by), atom( variable( publication)), data( nzbc)), expression( function( has), atom( variable( publication)), data( condition of use)), expression( function( is), atom( variable( condition of use)), data( true)))), then( and( expression( function( comply with), atom( relation( element), variable( building)), data( nzbc b2 as1)), expression( function( comply with), atom( relation( material), variable( building)), data( nzbc b2 as1)), expression( function( comply with), atom( relation( component), variable( building)), data( nzbc b2 as1)), expression( function( comply with), atom( relation( system), variable( building)), data( nzbc b2 as1))))

text: 2.1.2 It is the responsibility of the person specifying the building element to determine normal maintenance requirements. These may be based on the manufacturer's recommendations and may also include periodic inspections of elements not readily observable without a specific effort (e.g. access to roof or subfloor spaces).
lrml: if( expression( function( specified by), atom( relation( element), variable( building)), data( specifier))), then( and( obligation( expression( function( include), atom( variable( maintenance)), data( manufacturers recommendations))), obligation( expression( function( include), atom( variable( maintenance)), data( periodic inspections))), obligation( expression( function( is), atom( relation( responsibility), variable( maintenance)), data( specifier)))))

text: 2.1.3 Basic normal maintenance tasks shall include but not be limited to: a) Where applicable, following manufacturers' maintenance recommendations, b) Washing down surfaces, particularly exterior building elements subject to wind driven salt spray, c) Re-coating interior and exterior protective finishes, d) Replacing sealant, seals and gaskets in joints, e) Replacing valves, washers and similar high wear components in easily accessed service equipment and other building elements, f) Cleaning and replacing filters in building services systems, g) The regular servicing of boilers, cooling towers, lifts, escalators, emergency lighting and fire protection equipment, and h) The maintenance of signs for access, escape routes, emergency equipment and hazardous areas. COMMENT: Maintenance does not include such things as upgrading building elements to meet the demands of new technology or the increased environmental expectations of users.

text: All slab-on-ground reinforcing shall extend to within 75 mm of the outside edge of the slab (including the foundation wall) and shall consist of a minimum 2.27kg/m2 welded Grade 500E reinforcing mesh sheets (1.14 kg/m2 in each direction), which shall be lapped at sheet joints such that the overlap measurement between the outermost cross wires of each fabric sheet is equal to the greater of one of the following: the spacing of cross wires plus 50 mm, 150 mm, or the manufacturer's requirements. Slabs shall have a maximum dimension of 18 m between free joints.

text: 2.1.1 Screens, grit chambers, grease traps or similar appropriate equipment should be installed at the head of piping systems if suspended solids or material within the liquid waste might cause blockage of the piping system.
lrml: if( and( atom( relation( blockage), variable( piping system), data( possible), operator( is)), atom( relation( cause), variable( blockage), data( suspended solid), operator( equal)))), then( and( obligation( atom( relation( at the head of), variable( piping system), data( screens), operator( has))), obligation( atom( relation( at the head of), variable( piping system), data( grit chamber), operator( has))), obligation( atom( relation( at the head of), variable( piping system), data( grease trap), operator( has)))))

text: 2.1.2 Wherever possible, piping systems shall convey industrial liquid waste using gravity flow.
lrml: if( atom( variable( industrial liquid waste), data( piping system), operator( conveyed in))), then( obligation( atom( relation( disposal method), variable( industrial liquid waste), data( gravity flow), operator( equal))))

text: 2.1.3 Gravity flow pipelines should have sufficient gradient to provide flow velocities that prevent the settlement of entrained solids and grit.
lrml: if( atom( relation( disposal method), variable( industrial liquid waste), data( gravity flow), operator( equal))), then( and( obligation( atom( relation( slope), variable( pipeline), data( sufficient), operator( is))), atom( relation( velocity), variable( flow), data( velocity causing sediment), operator( greater than))))

text: 2.3.2 Joints, fittings and valves – The number of joints, fittings and valves in the piping system shall be kept to a practical minimum.
lrml: if( atom( variable( industrial liquid waste), data( piping system), operator( conveyed in))), then( and( obligation( expression( function( count), atom( relation( joint), variable( piping system), data( minimum), operator( is)))), expression( function( count), atom( relation( fitting), variable( piping system), data( minimum), operator( is))), expression( function( count), atom( relation( valve), variable( piping system), data( minimum), operator( is)))))

text: 2.3.3 Bends shall have a centreline radius of no less than 1.5 times the nominal pipe diameter.
lrml: if( atom( relation( bend), variable( piping system))), then( obligation( atom( relation( centreline radius), variable( bend), data( 1.5*( nominal pipe diameter)), operator( greater than equal))))

text: 3.2.1 Free-standing tanks shall be secured against earthquake forces. The methods given in NZS 4219 are acceptable.
lrml: if( atom( relation( type), variable( tank), data( free standing))), then( and( obligation( atom( relation( protection), variable( tank), data( seismic), operator( equal))), permission( atom( relation( seismic restraint), variable( tank), data( nzs 4219), operator( comply)))))
